title: NATO Membership for Sweden, Finland on Track, Officials Say
description: The Northern European nations’ foreign ministers met in Washington with Secretary of State Antony Blinken, and all three voiced optimism that Turkey and Hungary, the final two NATO members that haven’t ratified the new members, would do so soon.

title: Quebec Shuns Bitcoin Mining in Bid to Conserve Power
description: The Canadian province wants to stop selling cheap power to cryptocurrency miners and direct energy to other areas, a priority shift.

title: The Five-Year Engineering Feat Germany Pulled Off in Months
description: Europe is racing to build natural-gas facilities to keep its economy afloat. If it fails to shore up its energy grid, governments might have to ration fuel this winter. “This project is really a race against time,” said one manager.

title: Police Seize Weapons in Far-Right German Coup-Plot Investigation
description: The group hoarded weapons, subscribed to esoteric conspiracies and commissioned occultists to help plan a coup, officials say.

title: Argentina Binges on the World Cup to Forget Soaring Inflation and Unrest
description: During the monthlong tournament, protesters stay home during matches, people celebrate in the street and economic woes take a back seat.

title: Peru's New President Faces Same Turmoil That Ousted Predecessor
description: Dina Boluarte, the country’s first female president, began her first full day as president after Pedro Castillo was ousted by Congress.

title: Harry and Meghan Detail Their Royal Woes in Netflix Series
description: The couple launched their latest broadside at the British royal family, highlighting the institution’s historic links to slavery and the struggle the biracial actress faced integrating into the house of Windsor during a television series for Netflix.

title: South Korea Orders Truckers Back to Work as Labor Tensions Rise Globally
description: President Yoon widened the scope of a back-to-work order to include the steel and petrochemical industries, after issuing a similar order for the cement sector last week.

title: Foxconn Letter Prodded China to Ease Zero-Covid Rules
description: The founder of the world’s largest iPhone assembler warned that the government’s strict policies would threaten its position in global supply chains.

title: Brittney Griner Released From Russian Penal Colony in Prisoner Release Deal
description: U.S. basketball star Brittney Griner was released by Russia from a penal colony in a negotiated prisoner release deal, a U.S. official said. She is in U.S. custody.

title: China Braces for Deadly Covid Wave After Loosening Controls
description: Strained hospitals and the country’s poor vaccination rates could lead to over a million deaths, according to some public health experts. “It will put unprecedented strain on the Chinese health system,” a scientist said.

title: Ukraine Says Western Allies Shouldn't Fear Russia Falling Apart
description: Ukraine’s foreign minister defended Kyiv’s right to strike targets on Russian soil and vowed that Ukraine would never accept a peace settlement that leaves occupied lands, including Crimea, under Moscow’s control.

title: Ukraine Hit by Deadliest Single Russian Attack on Civilians in Weeks
description: Russian strikes killed at least 10 people in eastern Ukraine, as President Vladimir Putin said he was preparing for a long, protracted conflict in the country.

title: Iran Conducts First Known Execution of Prisoner Arrested During Protests
description: The man was convicted of blocking a street in Tehran by holding a “machete” and of injuring a member of the Basij paramilitary force, which has been deployed to suppress demonstrations.

title: Russians March on Foot to Advance in Eastern Ukraine Battle
description: The battle for Bakhmut has become a bloodbath for both sides as Russia steps up its attempts to take what used to be a quaint, tree-lined city.
